Class Level

java.lang.Object
game.levels.Level
Direct Known Subclasses:
Level1, Level2, Level3, Level4
public abstract class Level extends Object
Abstract base class for a game level.

Provides a common structure and helper methods for setting up game objects like platforms, enemies, collectibles, and flags. Subclasses must implement the setupLevelSpecific method to define their unique level layout.

This class follows the Template Method design pattern, where:

  • The setupLevel(World) method defines the common algorithm for level setup
  • The setupLevelSpecific(World) abstract method allows subclasses to customize the level layout
  • Helper methods like createPlatform(World, Vec2) provide standardized ways to create game entities

Concrete level implementations (e.g., Level1, Level2) extend this class and define their specific layouts by overriding setupLevelSpecific. This approach ensures consistency across levels while allowing for unique designs.

  • Field Details

    • platformTexture

      protected String platformTexture
      The texture to use for platforms in the level. Subclasses must assign this.

      This field should be initialized in the constructor of concrete level classes to specify the visual appearance of platforms for that specific level.

  • Constructor Details

    • Level

      public Level()

  • Method Details

    • setupLevel

      public void setupLevel(city.cs.engine.World world)
      Sets up the level by invoking the level-specific setup routine, followed by placing the common level-end flag.

      This method implements the Template Method design pattern by:

      1. First calling the abstract setupLevelSpecific(World) method that subclasses must implement
      2. Then placing a level-completion flag at a standard position

      This ensures that all levels have a consistent structure while allowing for customization in the specific layout of platforms, enemies, and collectibles.

      Parameters:
      world - The World in which the level is being set up. This is typically a GameWorld instance.

    • setupLevelSpecific

      protected abstract void setupLevelSpecific(city.cs.engine.World world)
      Abstract method to define level-specific setup logic. Subclasses must override this to add their custom platforms, enemies, etc.

      This is where the unique layout and challenges of each level are defined. Implementations typically use the helper methods provided by this class (such as createPlatform(city.cs.engine.World, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2), createEnemy(city.cs.engine.World, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2, float), etc.) to place game objects at specific positions.

      Example implementation: 

       
 protected void setupLevelSpecific(World world) {
     // Set platform texture for this level
     platformTexture = "data/platform2.png";

     // Create platforms
     createPlatform(world, new Vec2(-8, -8));
     createPlatform(world, new Vec2(0, -5));

     // Add collectibles
     createCollectible(world, new Vec2(-8, -6));

     // Add enemies
     createEnemy(world, new Vec2(5, -9), 2.0f);
 }

      Parameters:
      world - The game world in which to place the objects.

    • createDefaultEntities

      protected void createDefaultEntities(city.cs.engine.World world)
      Creates default entities in the specified world.

      This method is responsible for adding default enemies and collectibles to the world. It is typically called during the initialization of the world to set up the initial game state. The specific entities added are determined by the implementation of this method in subclasses.

      Parameters:
      world - The world in which to create the default entities.
      See Also:
      • World

    • createPlatform

      protected void createPlatform(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position)
      Creates a static platform at the given position.

      Platforms are the primary surfaces that the player can walk and jump on. They use the texture specified by the platformTexture field, which should be set by the concrete level implementation.

      Parameters:
      world - The game world.
      position - The position for the platform, specified as a 2D vector.

    • createCollectible

      protected void createCollectible(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position)
      Creates a collectible item at the specified position.

      Collectibles are items that the player can gather to increase their score. The player typically needs to collect all items in a level to complete it.

      Parameters:
      world - The game world.
      position - The position for the collectible, specified as a 2D vector.

    • createObstacle

      protected void createObstacle(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position)
      Creates an obstacle at the specified position.

      Obstacles are hazardous objects that damage the player upon contact. They typically reduce the player's health when touched.

      Parameters:
      world - The game world.
      position - The position for the obstacle, specified as a 2D vector.

    • createEnemy

      protected void createEnemy(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position, float speed)
      Creates a walking enemy at the specified position and with the given speed.

      Walking enemies move horizontally along platforms and damage the player upon contact. They can be defeated by jumping on top of them.

      Parameters:
      world - The game world.
      position - The starting position of the enemy, specified as a 2D vector.
      speed - The speed at which the enemy moves, in units per second. Positive values move right, negative values move left.

    • createFlyingEnemy

      protected void createFlyingEnemy(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position)
      Creates a flying enemy at the specified position.

      Flying enemies move in a pattern through the air and are not constrained to platforms. They damage the player upon contact and typically follow a predefined flight path.

      Note: This method requires the world parameter to be a GameWorld instance, as flying enemies need access to game-specific functionality.

      Parameters:
      world - The game world, must be a GameWorld instance.
      position - The starting position of the flying enemy, specified as a 2D vector.

    • createFlag

      protected void createFlag(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position)
      Places the level-completion flag at the specified position.

      The flag represents the goal that the player must reach to complete the level. Typically, the player must also collect all collectibles before the flag will trigger level completion.

      Parameters:
      world - The game world.
      position - The location of the flag, specified as a 2D vector.
